newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SMB hits high of S$0.32 at open.
newsitem.headline: SMB hits high of S$0.32 at open.

text.p: Newly-listed SMB United Ltd hit a high of Singapore $0.32 cents at the open on Monday, giving it a three cent premium over its initial offer price of S$0.29.
Dealers said the stock quickly traded down to its IPO price of S$0.29 before recovering to S$0.305 after 20 minutes of trading. Volume was about 7.4 million shares.

"The debut was a bit disappointing. There was only one lot traded at S$0.32 at the open. Most people had expected that price to hold at least. There are lots of sellers queued at S$0.32," said a dealer with a local broking firm.
She said general weak market sentiment affected trading in SMB, which had offered 103.13 million shares in its IPO.
SMB is a manufacturer of low voltage switchgears used in power distribution. -- Singapore Newsroom 65-8703080
